body:
# dark-sky

Crystal implementation of the DarkSky weather API

Based primarily the Go implementation.

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:
```yaml
dependencies:
  dark-sky:
    github: dscottboggs/dark-sky
```
2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

```crystal
require "dark-sky"

ENV["darksky_api_key"] = "your-api-key-here"

weather = DarkSky::Forecast.new(longitude: -58.47028, latitude: -34.52959)
weather.retreive # current weather
weathe.at(Time.now + 1.day) # weather tomorrow.

```

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/dscottboggs/dark-sky/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [D. Scott Boggs](https://github.com/dscottboggs) - creator and maintainer

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (latitude, longitude, time = nil, units = DEFAULT_UNITS, language = DEFAULT_LANUGAGE)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(latitude, longitude, time, units, language)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance

instance_methods.name: at
instance_methods.doc:
set the @time attribute, and request a new batch of results with the new
time set. This will return a JSONResults::Forecast for the given time.
instance_methods.summary: set the @time attribute, and request a new batch of results with the new time set.

instance_methods.name: retreive
instance_methods.doc:
Request the HTTP result, returning an instance of Forecast with the values
all filled in from the server
instance_methods.summary: Request the HTTP result, returning an instance of Forecast with the values all filled in from the server

def.name: retreive
def.body:
HTTP::Client.get(url) do |response|
  begin
    if response.status_code === 200
    else
      raise(ConnectionException.new(response, url))
    end
    (self.class.from_json(response.body_io)).tap do |o|
      o.time = @time
      o.units = @units
      o.language = @language
    end
  rescue e : JSON::ParseException
    pp!(url)
    pp!(response.try do |__arg0|
      __arg0.body_io.gets_to_end
    end || "nil!")
    raise(e)
  end
end
